description: President Javier Milei is taking a softer tone than he did as a candidate, saying he won’t touch existing trade agreements with Beijing.
title: Giving Up China Is Hard, Even for Argentina’s Anarcho-Capitalist

description: A regional politician holding up Japan’s maglev program is resigning. Authorities must get this train back on track.
title: World's Biggest NIMBY Gets Derailed on $60 Billion Project

description: Attacks on a Malaysian convenience store chain over an insult to Islam have the potential to rock Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim’s fragile coalition in the Muslim-majority nation.
title: Petrol Bomb Attacks on Malaysian Supermart Raise Heat on Anwar

description: Federal officials are poised to release preliminary findings of their investigation into the Baltimore bridge collapse that killed six and shut down Baltimore’s port last week.
title: US Set to Release Preliminary Results of Baltimore Bridge Investigation

description: Senate Republicans are poised to sink a $78 billion tax-cut package, gambling that they’ll win the majority in November and can push then for bigger breaks for business.
title: Bipartisan $78 Billion Tax Deal Hits GOP Roadblock in US Senate

description: The Biden administration pushed Russia to support a US-backed resolution at the United Nations Security Council that would warn countries against placing nuclear weapons in orbit, after reports emerged that President Vladimir Putin may be planning to do so.
title: US Pressures Russia to Embrace UN Push Against Nukes in Space

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, Big Take DC senior producer Naomi Shavin previews the podcast about the new IRS e-filing program. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: IRS Takes a First Step Into E-Filing for This Year’s Tax Returns

description: The Israeli drone strike in Gaza that killed seven aid workers — including three Britons — is exposing new fissures in Rishi Sunak’s cabinet as pressure mounts on the UK prime minister to suspend arms sales to Tel Aviv.
title: Israel Arms Debate Opens Fresh Rift in Sunak’s Fractious Cabinet

description: UBS AG won dismissal of a lawsuit by the software company that built former President Donald Trump’s 2020 campaign app accusing the bank of manipulating its shares by placing so-called spoof trades.
title: UBS Defeats Spoofing Suit by Trump 2020 Campaign App Maker

description: No Labels, the centrist political group that sought to shake up the 2024 presidential campaign with a third-party candidate to rival Joe Biden and Donald Trump, said Thursday it wouldn’t field a candidate after all.
title: No Labels Quits Third-Party Bid Effort Against Biden, Trump

description: Aaron Peskin, a prominent figure in San Francisco’s progressive politics, has announced his candidacy for mayor, introducing a new dynamic to a race currently dominated by moderates.
title: San Francisco Mayor Race Heats Up as Progressive Jolts Moderates

description: A federal judge denied Donald Trump’s bid to get criminal charges dropped by claiming top secret records found at his Florida home were personal, keeping the criminal case on track and dealing a blow to the former president.
title: Judge Denies Trump’s Bid to Claim Secret Documents Were Personal

description: President Joe Biden told Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu that US support for his war in Gaza would depend on new steps to protect civilians, a shift in position for the US leader who has faced mounting pressure to take a harder line against Israel amid mounting deaths.
title: Biden Tells Netanyahu US Support Hinges on Protecting Civilians

description: President Joe Biden told Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu that US support for his war in Gaza depends on new steps to protect civilians, a shift in position for the US leader who has faced increased pressure to take a harder line against Israel amid mounting deaths.
title: Biden Tells Netanyahu US Support Hinges on Protecting Civilians

description: Nigeria’s President Bola Tinubu signed a law setting up a student loan fund to expand access to education for those that cannot afford to pay tuition amid a cost-of-living crisis in the West African nation.
title: Nigeria to Offer Student Loans to Expand Access to Education

description: Miami-Dade County is scrapping a $2.5 billion debt package after backlash the proposal failed include funding to improve one of the worst transit networks in the nation.
title: Miami Abandons Plan for $2.5 Billion Bond After Transit Backlash

description: A Georgia judge declined to dismiss the racketeering indictment against Donald Trump and several co-defendants, ruling that their efforts to overturn the 2020 election weren’t protected by the First Amendment.
title: Trump Loses Bid to Dismiss Georgia Case on Free Speech Grounds

description: New York Attorney General Letitia James asked an appeals court to require Donald Trump to prove within 10 days that the company providing his $175 million bond in the state’s civil fraud case is financially capable of delivering if his legal challenges fail.
title: Trump Bond Firm Should Offer Proof of Resources, New York Says

description: Venezuela said it will begin talks with international electoral observation missions next week as Nicolás Maduro faces criticism of unfairness ahead of a July 28 presidential vote.
title: Venezuela Reaches Out to Foreign Election Monitors After Allies Criticize Vote

description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said Canada’s upcoming budget won’t include new taxes on the middle class, but did not comment on whether the government will introduce other measures to boost tax revenue.
title: Trudeau Says He Won’t Raise Taxes on Middle Class in Budget

description: President Joe Biden’s advisers have called major Baltimore employers — including Amazon.com Inc. and Home Depot Inc. — to encourage them to retain jobs despite the bridge collapse that shut the city’s port, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Biden’s Advisers Urge Amazon, Home Depot to Keep Baltimore Jobs

description: Peru’s Congress rejected two impeachment motions against unpopular President Dina Boluarte on Thursday, who is navigating a criminal investigation over illegal enrichment and a political scandal over her use of Rolex watches.
title: Peru’s Congress Rejects Impeaching Boluarte Over Rolex Scandal

description: McDonald’s Corp. agreed to acquire its restaurants in Israel from operator Alonyal Ltd., bringing the local chain in-house months after it became a point of contention in the early days of the Israel-Hamas war.
title: McDonald’s to Buy Israel Franchise That Became Flashpoint in Hamas War

description: Legal challenges to the New York Metropolitan Transportation Authority’s congestion pricing plan threaten to undo the agency’s success at reining in its borrowing costs.
title: NYC Congestion Pricing Fight Threatens MTA’s Progress on Debt Costs

description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s government is creating a C$1.5 billion ($1.1 billion) program to help Canadian nonprofit organizations buy affordable apartment buildings and keep the rents down.
title: Trudeau Creates Fund For Nonprofits to Buy Apartment Buildings

description: Mexico’s election is already shaping up to be the most violent in the country’s modern history.
title: With 399 Victims, Mexico Campaign Violence Is Already at Record

description: Senior US officials will visit the Netherlands later this month to pressure the Dutch government to toughen its China chip equipment curbs, as the Biden administration ramps up its campaign to thwart Beijing’s technology ambition.
title: US Officials to Pressure Dutch Government on China Chip Curbs

description: A lawmaker from Germany’s far-right AfD party denied taking money from a Czech-based, pro-Russia media outlet and accused the government in Prague of a defamation campaign designed to influence the outcome of June’s European Parliament elections.
title: German Far-Right MP Denies Taking Cash From Pro-Russian Media

description: The growing possibility of a state rescue at Thames Water is weighing on debt that was previously considered to be insulated from the utility company’s woes.
title: Thames Water’s Safer Bonds Start to Drop on State Rescue Fears

description: Angola’s Constitutional Court overturned the conviction of Jose Filomeno dos Santos, son of the former president, in a $500 million graft case, citing violations of his right to a fair trial.
title: Angola Court Overturns Dos Santos Son’s Graft Conviction

description: NATO allies are reining in expectations about the viability of a proposed $100 billion fund to support Ukraine as the alliance grapples with how to provide sufficient aid to Kyiv to ward off Russia’s invasion for the long term.
title: NATO Allies Urge Caution Over $100 Billion Aid Plan for Ukraine

description: Get caught up on the day’s political news
title: Setting Up A Super-Majority: Poll Predicts A Labour Landslide

description: A slump in South African dollar bonds has made them the biggest laggards in developing markets this year, reflecting concern among investors that a market-unfriendly coalition government may emerge from next month’s elections.
title: Election Anxiety Makes South Africa Dollar Bonds the Worst in EM

description: Turkey’s President Recep Tayyip Erdogan is withholding billions of dollars of municipal funds that are crucial for investment in cities such as Istanbul and Ankara, according to the head of the main opposition party.
title: Turkey Opposition Says Erdogan Withholding Billions From Cities

description: Finland extended the closure of the NATO defense bloc’s longest border with Russia, citing continued risks to its national security.
title: Finland Extends Russian Border Closure on Security Risk

description: Senegal will review agreements signed with natural-resources companies to ensure they’re optimized for the state to benefit, newly elected President Bassirou Diomaye Faye said.
title: Senegal’s New Leader Announces Audit of Oil, Mining Industries

description: France will lobby the European Union for measures to re-balance trade with China based on environmental criteria as it sees an economic threat from a glut of Chinese products flooding the bloc’s market.
title: France Pushes EU for Measures to Re-Balance Trade With China

description: Israel’s economy minister said he didn’t trust Qatar to act as a mediator with Hamas and accused the Gulf country of “funding terror all over the world.”
title: Israel Minister Says Qatar Is Deceitful as Broker For Hamas

description: Somalia has expelled the Ethiopian ambassador and shut down its neighbor’s consulates in the breakaway regions of Somaliland and Puntland over Addis Ababa’s attempt to secure direct access to the the Gulf of Aden, Ali Balcad, Somalia’s state minister for foreign affairs said.
title: Somalia Expels Ethiopian Ambassador Over Gulf of Aden Port Spat

description: The president is bolstering welfare programs to help his Morena Party win the June election. That will be a tough act for the next administration to keep up.
title: AMLO Spends Like Never Before to Set Up Successor’s Victory in Mexico

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: NATO at 75 Has Reason to Celebrate — and Worry

description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak is under mounting pressure to suspend British arms sales to Israel as three former supreme court justices warned the UK is breaching international law by arming the country during the war in Gaza.
title: Sunak Under Pressure to Suspend UK Weapons Sales to Israel

description: Russian Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu held a rare phone talk with his French counterpart Sebastien Lecornu on the war in Ukraine.
title: Russia and France Hold Rare Talks Over Phone on War in Ukraine

description: Politicians and their allies, some backed by anonymous donors, are pushing courts to the center of the election process.
title: The 2024 US Election Is Already Being Fought in the Courts

description: Cease-fire negotiations between Israel and Hamas are stalling again, Israeli officials say, with large gaps between the sides over hostages, prisoners and the future of Gaza.
title: Israel Says Large Gaps Remain With Hamas Over Gaza Cease-Fire

description: Irish unity would require large tax rises and cuts to public expenditure, according to a new study that lays bare the costs to the Republic of Ireland of any future reunification with Northern Ireland.
title: Ireland Would Need Big Tax Rise to Fund Unification, Study Says

description: Russian forces intensified their attacks on Ukraine’s second-largest city overnight, launching a barrage of at least 15 explosive-laden Shahed drones against Kharkiv.
title: Ukraine Says Four Killed in Russian Drone Attack on Kharkiv

description: Separatist militants killed at least five members of Iran’s security forces in multiple attacks in the country’s southeast, state media reported.
title: Iran Says Five Security Forces Killed in Separatist Attacks

description: South Africa’s former speaker of parliament, Nosiviwe Mapisa-Nqakula, handed herself over to the authorities after facing the threat of arrest over graft charges.
title: South Africa’s Former Speaker Hands Herself Over to Authorities

description: Top oil exporter rethinks priorities as it carries a bigger spending burden for megaprojects.
title: Saudi Crown Prince MBS’ $100 Billion Foreign Investment Quest Falters

description: The SkyBridge Capital founder and former White House communications director tells In the City the consensus from Davos is not to be believed.
title: Why Scaramucci Is Predicting Trump Will Lose

description: More than half of the world’s low-income countries are at high risk of debt distress or are already in it, and several have defaulted. But despite the world’s 20 largest economies having agreed in 2020 to a plan called the Common Framework to smooth the process of restructuring loans that governments could no longer afford to service or repay, progress toward actually providing relief has been slow. Delays have partly stemmed from disagreements between the rich countries that have traditionally
title: Why the G-20 ‘Common Framework’ for Debt Relief Isn’t Helping Poor Nations

description: Kuwaitis go to the polls on Thursday for the fourth time in as many years, seeking to choose a new parliament after a protracted period of little change beyond campaign slogans and unrealized government plans.
title: Kuwait Votes Again in Bid For Change Despite Political Stalemate

description: Japan’s Prime Minister Fumio Kishida is set to punish ruling party lawmakers caught concealing political funds, as he seeks to move on from a scandal that sent his voter support to record lows.
title: Japan PM to Punish Lawmakers Caught in Political Funding Scandal

description: Peru’s Congress voted to confirm embattled President Dina Boluarte’s new Cabinet on Wednesday, an expected endorsement even as it set the stage for a coming impeachment debate.
title: Peru’s Congress Backs Boluarte as It Plans Impeachment Debate
